intro: Pharnaceum mucronatum, commonly known as the sharp-tipped pharnaceum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
